lines.text: You know somethin', Robin. I was just wonderin', are we good guys or bad guys? You know, I mean, uh? Our robbin' the rich to feed the poor.
Rob? Tsk tsk tsk. That's a naughty word. We never rob. We just sort of borrow a bit from those who can afford it.
Borrow? Boy, are we in debt.
[about Robin]
Oh, he's so handsome, just like his reward posters.

[after just swinging her to safety, he takes her hand]
Marian, my love, will you marry me?
Oh, darling, I thought you'd never ask me!
[moves behind Robin Hood so he can continue to fight the Sheriff's men]

[giggles]
But you could have chosen a more romantic setting!
London! Normandy!
Yes!
Sunny Spain?

[laughs]
Why not?

[the Sheriff has taken the only coin from the Poor Box, and Friar Tuck is furious]
You thieving scandal!
Now, take it easy, Friar, I'm just doing my duty.
Collecting taxes for that arrogant, greedy, ruthless, no-good Prince John?
Listen, Friar, you're mighty preachy and you're gonna preach your neck right into a hangman's noose.

[shouts]
Get out of my church! Out! Out! Out! Out!
[pushes the Sheriff out into the rain]
You want taxes? I'll give you taxes!
[begins assaulting the Sheriff]
Oh, Friar Tuck. It appears that I now have an outlaw for an in-law.
Oh, incidentally, I'm Alan-A-Dale, a minstrel. That's an old time folk singer. My job is to tell it like it is, or was, or whatever.
[the Sheriff of Nottingham enters the castle singing]
He throws an angry tantrum if he cannot have his way / He calls for Mom and sucks his thumb and doesn't want to play / Too late to be known as John the First, he's sure to be known as John the Worst!
[to Sir Hiss]

[speaking]
Am I right?

[chuckles]
That's P.J. to a "T". Let me try, let me try.
[lowers his voice]

[singing]
Too late to be known as John the First, he's sure to be known as John the Worst!
[sees an angry Prince John peeking behind a door, with a glass jug of wine in his hand, shrivels]
The Fabulous, Marvelous, Merciful, Chivalrous.
Oh, you've got it all wrong, Hiss. The Sniveling, Groveling, Measely, Weaseling.

[shouts]
Enough!
[throws the glass jug at the Sheriff, but it hits the wall and the wine rains down on him]
But, but Sire, it's a big hit. The whole village is singing it.
Oh, they are, are they? Well, they'll be singing a different tune. Double the taxes! Triple the taxes!
[grabs Sir Hiss by the neck]
Squeeze every last drop out of those insolent musical peasants.

[He and Little John are dressed as Gypsy women]
Ooh-de-la-lay! Ooh-de-la-lay! Fortune tellers!
Fortunes forecast! Lucky charms!
Catch the dope with your horoscope!

[in disguise]
I'm gonna win that Golden Arrow, and then I'm goin' to present meself to Maid Marian.
Listen, Scissorbill. If you shoot half as well as you blabbermouth, you're better than Robin Hood.
Robin Hood, he says? Wowee! I'm tip-top, alright, but I'm not as good as he is.
[Shoots a perfect bullseye]
[Prince John and Hiss have just been robbed by Robin Hood and Little John]
I knew it! I knew this would happen! I tried to warn you, but no, no, no, you wouldn't listen. You just had to.
[Prince John is about to hit Hiss with his mirror]
Ah! Ah! Ah! Seven years bad.
[crash]
Luck. That's what it is. Besides, you broke your mother's mirror.
Ahh! Mommy!
[sucks his thumb and gets mud all over it]
I've got a dirty thumb.
A perfect fit, Sire! Looks most becoming! You look regal, dignified, sincere, masterful, noble.
Don't overdo it, Hiss!
Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
Or forgetful.

[shouting]
One o'clock and all's well!

[clock chimes three times]
Nutsy, you better set your brain ahead two hours.
Right. Hey, Sheriff, does that there mean adding or subtracting?
Oh, just forget everything.
Yes sir, yes sir.
Nutsy, how am I supposed to sleep with you yelling "all's well" all the time?
You're burning the chow!
Sorry, Johnny. Guess I was thinking about Maid Marian again. I can't help it. I love her, Johnny.
Look, why don't you stop moonin' and mopin' around? - Just - Just marry the girl.
Marry her? You don't just walk up to a girl, hand her a bouquet and say, "Hey, remember me? We were kids together. Will you marry me?" No. It just isn't done that way.
Aw, come on, Robbie. Climb the castle walls. Sweep her off her feet. Carry her off in style.
It's no use, Johnny. I've thought it all out, and... it just wouldn't work. Besides, what have I got to offer her?
Well, for one thing, you can't cook.
I'm serious, Johnny. She's a highborn lady of quality.
So she's got class? So what?
I'm an outlaw, that's what. That's no life for a lovely lady. Always on the run. What kind of a future is that?
Oh, for heaven's sake, son. You're no outlaw. Why, someday you'll be called a great hero.
A hero? Do you hear that, Johnny? We've just been pardoned.
That's a gas. We ain't even been arrested yet.

[as Sir Reginald]
Ah, milord, the esteemed royal sovereign of the realm. The head man himself. You're beautiful.
Such savoir faire eclat elan, Hiss.
You took the words right out of my mouth, P.J.

[Absolutely delighted]
P.J.! I like that, do you know I do! Hiss, put it on my luggage.

[chasing Sir Hiss into the burning castle]
You cowardly cobra! Procrastinating python! Agravating asp! Ooh, you eel in snake's clothing!
Taxes! Taxes! Beautiful, lovely taxes! Ah-hah! Ah-hah!
Sire, you have an absolute skill for encouraging contributions from the poor.
[chuckles]
To coin a phrase, my dear counselor, rob the poor to give the rich.

[Prince John is sucking his thumb]
Sire, if you don't mind my saying, you see you have a very loud thumb.
[starts to hypnotize him]
Hypnosisss can cure you of your psychosis so easy.

[Snaps out of it and screams]
No, no! None of that!
Well, I was only trying to help.
I wonder. Silly serpent.
Silly serpent?
Stop! Executioner, stop! Hold your axe!

[threatening him with a dagger]
Okay, big shot, now tell him to untie my buddy, or I'll.
Sheriff, release my buddy! I mean, release the prisoner!
Untie the prisoner?
You heard what he said, bushel britches!
Sheriff, I make the rules! And since I'm head man.
[to Little John]
Not so hard, you mean thing.
[back to the Sheriff]
Let him go, for heaven sakes! Let him go!
[after being stuffed into a barrel full of ale]
Please! Please! I don't drink!
The prince? Wait a minute. There's a law against robbing royalty. I'll catch you later.
Alright, laugh, you two rouges, but there's gonna be a big to-do in Nottingham.
[tastes the stew and coughs]
Well done, ain't it? Old Prince John's having a championship archery tournament tomorrow.
Archery tournament? Huh! Old Rob could win that standing on his head. Huh, Rob?
Thank you, Little John, but I'm sure we're not invited.
No, but there's somebody who will be very dissapointed if you don't come.
Yeah, ol' Bushel Britches, the Honorable Sheriff of Nottingham.
No, Maid Marian.
Maid Marian?
Yeah. She's gonna give a kiss to the winner.
[laughs]
A kiss to the winner? Oodelaly! Come on, Johnny! What are we waiting for?
Wait a minute, Rob. Hold it. That place will be crawling with soldiers.
Ah, but remember faint hearts never won fair lady. Fear not, my friends.
[he shoots an arrow, it ricochets off a washing tub; Robin then throws his hat in the air, where it is ran through by the arrow and lands back on his head]
This will be my greatest performance.

[after sitting on Hiss]
Oh, excuse me, Buster.
Buster? You, sir, have taken my seat!

[laughs]
Hiss, with you around, who needs a court jester?
Robbed! I've been robbed! Hiss! You're never around when I need you!
[clears his throat]
I've been robbed.
Of course you've been robbed!
One more hiss out of you uhm Hiss. And you are walking to Nottingham.

[to himself]
Snakes don't walk, they slither. Hmph. So there.

You know, there's been a heap of legends and tall tales about Robin Hood. All different too. Well, we folks of the animal kingdom have our own version. It's the story of what really happened in Sherwood Forest.
Gee, you're beautiful.
Are you going to marry Robin Hood?
Mama says that you and Robin Hood are sweethearts.
Well you see, that was several years ago before I left for London.
Did he ever kiss you?
Well no, but he carved our initials on this tree. I remember it so well.
Are you gonna have any kids? My mom's got a lot of kids.
Oh, he's probably forgotten all about me.
Oh, not Robin Hood! I bet he'll storm the castle one day, fight the guards, rescue ya, and drag you off to Sherwood Forest!
Now, just a minute there, young man! You forgot all about Prince John!
That old Prince John don't scare me none!
I'm scared of Prince John. He's cranky.
[the Sheriff and the vultures are building a scaffold to hang Friar Tuck]
Well, Trigger. Everything's rigged up and all set.
Yep, it's one of the prettiest scaffolds you ever built, Sheriff.
Sheriff, don't you reckon you should give that trap door a test?
[pulls a lever and opens the trap door, allowing the Sheriff to fall in]
Criminently, now I know why your mama called you "Nutsy".
How nobly King Richard's crown sit on your royal brow.
Doesn't it? King Richard?
[wrings Hiss' neck]
I told you never to mention my brother's name!
A mere slip of the forked tongue, Sire.
Hiss! You're never around when I need you!
Coming, coming.
[begins singing 'For I'm a Jolly Good Fellow' until Prince John uncorks the barrel he's in]
Oh! there you are old boy! P.J., you're not going to believe this, but the stork is really Robin Hood.
Robin Hood?
[screams angrily]
[ties Hiss around a pole]
Get out of that if you can.

[sees Maid Marian]
There she is, Little John. Isn't she beautiful?
Cool it, loverboy! You're heart's running away with your head!
Ah, stop worrying. This disguise will fool my own mother.
Yeah, but your mom ain't here. You gotta fool ol' Bushel Britches.
Oh, Clucky, surely he must know how much I really love him.
But of course, my dear. Believe me, someday soon, your Uncle King Richard will have an outlaw for an in-law!
I am Sir Reginald, Duke of Chatne. And don't stick your tongue out at me, kid.
My trap is baited and set! And then, revenge! Ahh.
[screams so loud it almost blows off Hiss' skin]
Revenge!
Shh! Not so loud, sire! Remember, only you and I know, and your secret is my secret.
Little John? It can't be.

[unchains Friar Tuck]
Shh. Quiet, we're busting out here.
Thank God. My prayers have been answered.

[singing]
Every town / Has its ups and downs / Sometimes ups / Outnumber the downs / But not in Nottingham.
You gotta take the oath.
The oath?
Put your hand on your heart and cross your eyes.
Spider, snakes and a lizard head.

[repeats]
Spider, snakes and a lizard's head.
If I tattletale, I'll die till I'm dead.

[repeats]
If I tattletale, I'll die till I'm dead.
I sentence you to sudden, instant, and even immediate death!
Oh, no. Please. Please, sire. I beg of you to spare his life. Please have mercy.
My dear, emotional lady, why should I?
Because I love him, Your Highness.
Love him? And does this prisoner return your love?
Marian, my darling, I love you more than life itself.

[Sincerely]
Young love, your pleads have not fallen upon a heart of stone.
[Tone changes to fierce and determined]
But traitors to the crown must die!

[cutting him off]
Traitor to the crown? That crown belongs to King Richard. Long live King Richard!
Long live King Richard!
[gives the crowd a dirty look]
[Throwing a childish tantrum]
Enough! I am King! King! King! Off with his head!
Wait a minute. Is the safety on Old Betsy?

[tapping the side of the crossbow]
You bet it is, Sheriff.
That's what I'm afraid of. You go first.
Sire, taxes are pouring in, the jail is full. Oh and good news, Sire. Friar Tuck is in jail.

[Angry]
Friar Tuck? It's Robin Hood I want, you idiot! Oh, I'd give all my gold if I could get my hands on. Did you say, Friar Tuck?
Did I? Y-yes, I did.
Yes, yes! I have it, Hiss! I'll use that fat friar as bait to trap Robin Hood.
Another trap?
Yes, you stupid serpent. Friar Tuck will be led to the gallows at the village square, don't you see.
B-But Sire! Hang Friar Tuck? A man of the Church?
Yes, my reluctant reptile, and when our elusive hero tries to rescue the corpulent cleric
[laughs evilly]
my men will be ready.
[laughs evilly]
Criminently, Trigger! Point that peashooter the other way.
Don't you worry none, Sheriff. The safety's on Old Betsy.
[Old Betsy goes off]
What in tarnation you tryin' to do, you birdbrain?
Just doin' my duty, Sheriff.
Oh, you and that itchy trigger finger of yours.
As your lady in waiting, I'm waiting.

[singing]
All the world will sing of an English king a thousand years from now / And not because he's passed some law or had that lofty brow / While bonnie good King Richard leads the Great Crusade he's on / We'll all have to slave away for good for nothing, John / Incredible as he is inept / Whenever the history books are kept, they'll call him the Phony King of England.

[singing]
A pox on the Phony King of England.
Hey! Who's drivin' this flyin' umbrella?

[posing as a fortune teller]
A face appears. A crown is on his noble brow.
Oo-dee-lally! A crown! How exciting!
His face is handsom, regal, majestic, lovable. A cuddly face.
Handsome, regal, majestic, ha ha. Lovable, yes, yes. Cuddly.
[laughs]
Oh, that's me to a tease. It truly is.

[is slapped by Hiss]
Ooh!
Now what?
I uh I see your elustrious name.

[shouts]
I know my name! Get on with it!
Your name will go down, down, down in history, of course.
Yes! I knew it! I knew it! You hear that, Hiss? Oh you can't. He's in the basket. Don't forget it!

Man, oh man! That Prince John sure made good as threat! And his helpless subjects paid dearly for his humiliation, believe me. Taxes, taxes, taxes. Why he taxed the whole heart and soul out of the poor people of Nottingham, and if you couldn't pay your taxes, you went to jail. Yep, I'm in here too. Nottingham was in deep trouble.
Tell me, young man, how old are you?
Gosh, I'm seven years old! Going on eight!
Seven? That does make you the man of the house.

Well, even though, Prince John offered a huge reward for the capture of Robin Hood, that elusive Rob kept on robbing the rich to feed the poor, and believe me, it's a good thing he did, because what with taxes and all, the poor folks Nottingham were starving to death.
Sire, sire, they may be bandits.
Oh, poppycock. Female bandits? What next? Rubbish. Um, um, my dear ladies, you have my permission to kiss the royal hands. Whichever you like, first.
You know something, Robin? You're taking too many chances.
Chances? You must be joking! That was just a bit of a lark, Little John.
Oh, yeah? Take a look at your hat. That's not a candle on a cake.

[regarding the arrow in his hat]
Hello! This one almost had my name on it, didn't it? They're getting better, you know. You've got to admit it! They are getting better.
Yeah, the next thing you know, that sheriff will probably have a rope around our necks!
[gags as he chokes himself]
Pretty hard to laugh hanging there, Rob!
The sheriff and his whole possy couldn't lift you off the ground.

[smacking Prince John on the head with the golden arrow]
Take that, you scurvy knave!
Seize the fat one!
It smarts, don't it, Otto? But Prince John says if taxes should hurt.

[shouts]
Now, see here, you evil, flint-hearted.
Now, now, now, now! Save your sermin, preacher. It ain't Sunday, you know.
What cheek! Creepy? Buster? Long one? Who does that dupey duke think he is?
Praise the Lord, and pass the tax rebate!
This crown gives me a feeling of power! Power! Forgive me a cruel chuckle. Heh-heh-heh. Power.
Stop, hee hee hee, stop hissing in my ear!
Well, greetings from your friendly neighborhood tax collector.
Oh, take it easy on me, Sheriff. What with this busted leg and all, I'm way behind on my work, Sheriff.
I know, Otto, but you're way behind on your taxes too.
Oh, have a heart, Sheriff. Can't you see he's laid up?
Good bye, Mr. Robin Hood. Come again at my birthday!
I told Skippy he was shooting it too high.
Well, I'm sure glad he did. Now I get to meet all of you.
And now, your mightiness, allow me to lay some protocol on you.
Oh, no, forgive me, but I lose more jewels that way.
Gee, Skippy, how come you're going?
Well, Robin Hood's gonna have kids, so somebody's gotta keep their eye on things.
Howdy, Friar! Well, it looks like I dropped in just in time!
What does that big-bellied bully want here?

[to Otto as he's sitting down]
Let me give you a hand with that leg.
[lifts up Otto's leg]
Upsie-daisy.
[farthings fall out of Otto's cast into the Sheriff's hand]
Bingo! Oh, what they won't think of next!
Friar Tuck, we've saved this. It's not much, but please take it for the poor.
Your last farthing? Oh, Little Sister, no one can give more than that!
[deposits farthing into the poor box]
Bless you both!
Oh, we were just saving it for a rainy day.
Well, it's raining now!
I tried to tell you, but no, no, no, you wouldn't listen. Your traps just never work. And now look what you've done to your mother's castle.
That's all of them. Get going!
This ain't no hayride. Let's move it outta here. Ho!
On to Sherwood Forest!
Hiss, this is a red letter day. A coup d'etat, to coin the Norman phrase.
That insolent blackguard. Oooh! I'll show him who wears the crown!
I share your loathing, Sire. That scurrilous scoundrel who fooled you with that silly disguise, who dared to rob you and made you look so utterly ridiculous.
Enough!
[swings at Hiss, who dodges him]
Hiss, you deliberately dodged.
But, but, but Sire, please.
Stop sniveling and hold still.
[Hiss holds still while Prince John hits him]

[dazed]
Thank you, Sire.
[hisses in Prince John's ear after Little John steals the diamonds from his rings]

[screams and chuckles]
Hiss oh you have hissed your last hiss.
[gulps after his neck has been tied into a knot and has a dirty look after Prince John puts him in his basket]
Suspicious snake.

[Little John is secretly holding a dagger on Prince John and demanding Robin Hood's release]
There's something funny going on around here.

[whispering]
Now, P.J. tell my pal to kiss Maid Marian, or I've just found a new pincushion.
[the Sheriff goes behind the throne and sees Little John]
Why, you!
[tries to hit Little John with his sword, but misses. Little John lets go of Prince John and hits the Sheriff back]

[shouts]
Kill him! Don't stand there, kill him!
We'll have six children!

[charmed]
Six? Oh, a dozen at least!

[Nutsy shoots an arrow at Robin, who dodges, and the ricochet just misses Nutsy. Marian, not content to let that go, smacks Nutsy in the face with a blackberry pie]
Take that!
[Marian and Robin laugh]
You're under arrest for high treason to the crown!
Ooh, what a main event this is! What a beautiful brawl!
Long live King Richard! Yeeeeeeeeeeee-hee!

[sobs]
Mother. Mother always did like Richard best.

[talking in his sleep]
It's Robin Hood I-Iwant.
What is the next stop Sir Hiss?
Let's see. I. Oh the next stop is Nottingham Sire.
Oh, Robin, you're so brave and impetuous!
